main event: Observers reported seeing two lights descending over the Hawaiian Islands on March 22, 1960.
interesting points: The lights were described as having the appearance of burning flares., The duration of the observation was approximately 20 seconds., The lights appeared to hit the ocean., There were conflicting conclusions about the nature of the lights, including possibilities of balloons, aircraft, or missiles., One witness noted a bright green light descending in an arc, thought to be a meteor.
witness description: Observers described the lights as bright and similar to flares.
